dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5553 IH: CTE Student Mental Health and Wellness Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Langworthy (for himself, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, and Ms. Bonamici) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to ensure area career and technical education schools are eligible for mental health and substance use disorder service grants.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the CTE Student Mental Health and Wellness Act.

section.header: Mental health and substance use disorder services for students in higher education
section.text: Section 520E–2 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–36b) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking an institution of higher education each place it appears and inserting a covered institution;
by striking the institution of higher education each place it appears and inserting the covered institution; and
by striking institutions of higher education each place it appears and inserting covered institutions;
in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking Any institution of higher education and inserting Any covered institution; and
in paragraph (5), by striking institution of higher education supported and inserting covered institution–supported; and

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (g) to read as follows:

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered institution means—

paragraph.text: an area career and technical education school (as defined in section 3 of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006); and
an institution of higher education (as defined in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965).
